etymologies: early 19th century. From the name of William Babington, Irish physician and mineralogist + -ite

definitions: A rare mineral occurring as dark greenish-black striated crystals, typically in association with zeolites.

notes.text: Babingtonite is a basic silicate of calcium, iron, and manganese, Ca₂(Fe,Mn)FeSi₅O₁₄(OH). Crystal system: triclinic.
